title: The long road to returning first-ever samples from Mars
description: When NASA's Perseverance rover touches down on Mars in February 2021, the mission will spend the next two years exploring one of the oldest and most intriguing sites on the red planet: Jezero Crater.

title: NASA-SpaceX mission: Astronauts prepare to board Crew Dragon from the ISS
description: NASA astronauts Robert Behnken and Douglas Hurley are preparing to leave the International Space Station this evening and begin their 19-hour journey home, capping off the their historic mission aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft.

title: US election poll: Analyst says this is the latest sign that Trump is in trouble
description: CNN analyst Harry Enten explains recent polling that shows some historically Republican states could be more competitive leading into the 2020 presidential election, and other factors that could make President Donald Trump's reelection challenging.

title: Connie Culp, the first person to receive a near-total face transplant in the US, has died
description: Connie Culp, the first person in the US to receive a near-total face transplant, has died, according to the Cleveland Clinic, where the procedure was performed in 2008. She was 57 years old.

title: Private school attended by Barron Trump prohibited from in-person learning
description: As President Donald Trump continues to demand a return to in-person classes for schools around the country despite the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, the school attended by his youngest son has received an order prohibiting on-campus learning for the start of the school year.

title: Thousands gather in Berlin to protest against Covid-19 restrictions
description: A large crowd of far-right groups gathered for a "sit-in" at Berlin's iconic Brandenburg Gate on Saturday to protest against the German government's coronavirus restrictions.

title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang brace helps Arsenal lift the FA Cup against Chelsea
description: Arsenal came from behind to claim the FA Cup with a 2-1 victory against Chelsea thanks to a Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang double at Wembley Stadium.

title: 'Nobody likes me,' Trump complains, as even his allies fade
description: Lamenting his plunging popularity this week, a self-pitying President Donald Trump wondered how it all went wrong.

title: Emirati woman smashes soccer 'hotstepping' Guinness record
description: Areej Al Hammadi, a young woman from the United Arab Emirates, has shattered the Guinness World Record for soccer ball "hotstepping," completing 86 repetitions of the ball control trick in a minute.

title: Congressman tests positive for Covid-19 then slams Republicans who won't wear masks
description: Arizona Democrat Rep. Raúl Grijalva has tested positive for coronavirus, his office confirmed Saturday.

title: TikTok users are freaking out over possible US ban
description: Late Friday night, a social platform best known for coordinated dance routines and funny videos turned somber. TikTok users across the US began livestreaming and posting videos in tribute to what they feared was the end of TikTok, the short-form video app they've come to love and depend on.

title: Indian politician Amar Singh dies at 64
description: Amar Singh, an Indian politician and former leading figure of the Samajwadi Party, has died aged 64, the country's Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Saturday.

title: Oil-rich UAE opens the Arab world's first nuclear power plant. Experts question why
description: The United Arab Emirates has launched a nuclear energy plant on Saturday, the first such project in the oil-rich Arab world.

title: Who should get the coronavirus vaccine first?
description: As the "warp speed" trials race to bring vaccines to market, who should be prioritized to get the first doses? Should race and income be included among factors? CNN's Michael Smerconish speaks with a medical ethicist.

title: Tennis' WTA Tour return to go ahead despite player's positive coronavirus test
description: The return of tennis' WTA Tour will go ahead as planned in Palermo despite an unnamed player testing positive for Covid-19.

title: Another treble for Paris Saint-Germain
description: Paris Saint-Germain sealed a fourth domestic treble in six seasons after overcoming Lyon on penalties in the French League Cup final.

title: Trump aides fight to make it harder for Democrats to vote by mail
description: Behind President Donald Trump's rhetoric railing against the expansion of vote-by-mail efforts ahead of the fall, his team is fighting to preserve the aspects of mail-in voting that they hope will offer Trump a strategic advantage.

title: Plane overloaded with cocaine crashes on take-off, exposing alleged crime syndicate
description: A light aircraft overloaded with cocaine crashed on take-off on its way to Australia, police said on Saturday, exposing a Melbourne-based crime syndicate and leading to the arrest of five men with alleged links to the Italian mafia.

title: Trump says he will ban TikTok
description: President Donald Trump said Friday night that he will ban the popular short-form video app TikTok from operating in the United States, rejecting a potential deal for Microsoft to buy the app from its Chinese-owned parent company.

title: Teen's unusual swing wows golfing legends
description: Five years ago, Kendall Kemm lost the ability to use her left arm, after treatment for a rare medical condition known as Arteriovenus Malformation.

title: Hong Kong is setting up a postponed election without a real opposition
Why Greece could be Europe's best holiday ticket right now
description: If you're wondering how coronavirus has affected that Greece vacation dream of blue skies, bluer seas, bright sunshine and the most delicious al fresco salad you've ever tasted -- it hasn't.

title: 'Rock star' WHO leader is stuck between feuding China and US
description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus was watching late-night television when he saw a hospital boss criticizing him and Ethiopia's Health Ministry, which he was leading at the time, for doing a terrible job. Instead of responding with a furious diatribe, as some political leaders might when watching their detractors on TV, he contacted the man, Dr. Kesete Admasu.

title: James Murdoch resigns from News Corp board over 'editorial content'
description: James Murdoch resigned from the board of his family's company News Corp on Friday, citing "disagreements over certain editorial content published by the Company's news outlets and certain other strategic decisions."

title: Taiwan could become the next flashpoint in the global tech war
description: The world is becoming increasingly dependent on a Taiwanese company for the most advanced semiconductors, after a stumble by rival Intel. But TSMC is trying to pull off a high-wire act by keeping both China and the United States happy at a time of rapidly escalating geopolitical tensions.

title: It's the world's largest dam. But does it work?
description: • China has just contained the coronavirus. Now it's battling some of the worst floods in decades

title: Hear why experts now question if masks are enough
description: Public health officials have been stressing the importance of wearing face masks to slow the spread of the coronavirus for months, but many experts are now urging the use of face shields and eye goggles as well. CNN's Brian Todd reports.
